ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: To end all argument or to warn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: to serve as an excuse or a warning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: to provide excuses for some and to give warnings to others:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: To complete the argument or to warn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: to excuse some and warn others:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By way of excuse or warning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Whether of Justification or of Warning;-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: To cut off all excuses or to warn;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [77:6] to excuse or to warn, that is to say, in order to excuse or to warn on behalf of God, exalted be He (a variant reading [for nudhran and ‘udhran] has nudhuran and ‘udhuran).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (To excuse) to leave no excuse for one to think that Allah is an oppressor or transgressor (or to warn) His created beings from His chastisement; it is also said that (to excuse) refers to that which He has made lawful while (or to warn) refers to that which He has made unlawful; and it is also said (to excuse) refers to His commands while (or to warn) refers to His prohibitions; Allah swore by all these things,
